cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 470 mi ESE of Key West, FL and 165 mi E of Camaguey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest along/just north of Cuba, forecast to regain tropical-storm strength near the Florida Keys and then curve northwest into the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the northern Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Florida Keys or extreme southwest Florida coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Florida Keys west of Ocean Reef to the Dry Tortugas and the southwest coast of Florida from Bonita Beach south and east to Ocean Reef, including Florida Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Cuba, Florida Keys, southern & central Florida Peninsula, northern Gulf Coast (FL Panhandle to AL/GA)
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤13% chance) of tropical-storm-force winds; strongest winds Saturday into early Sunday with gusts possibly 35–45 mph in squalls.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation (<3 ft) possible along Atlantic beaches and inlets but significant surge is not expected at Port Everglades.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with isolated totals up to 8 inches possible from Friday night through Sunday, producing urban and localized flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous surf/rip-currents beginning Saturday; periodic squalls could temporarily halt cargo handling operations.
